conclusion: Determine the coefficient of kinetic friction and mass of A using the graph.
Relationship between force and acceleration with friction: F - f = ma, where f = μN and N = mg.
Graph shows linear relationship between F and a.
Slope of the graph is Δa/ΔF.
At F = 48 N, a = 6 m/s²; at F = 60 N, a = 8 m/s².
Slope is 0.1667 m/s²/N, so m = 6 kg.
Y-intercept occurs when F = 0; acceleration is due to friction alone.
Coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.2 and mass of A is 6 kg.
